comments.author: nhnt11@gmail.com

comments.text: Having played with it further, it appears that the align-items: center rule in info-pages.css (https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev/b69a5bbb5e40bd426e35222baa600b481e50d265/toolkit/themes/shared/in-content/info-pages.inc.css#16) is causing the issue, seemingly in combination with the min-width: 13em found a little below that. The min-width rule causes overflow on the x axis. It appears that Firefox gets confused and centers everything, but only allows you to scroll right, so the left part gets clipped, if that makes sense. I'll see if I can come up with a workaround, but this might be a platform level bug. Not sure though.
comments.author: nhnt11@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 8766579
Patch

This patch fixes the bug. The content container has min-width: 13em, but the body doesn't, causing clipping. I set the min-width on the body but didn't accommodate any padding in favor of real estate when the width is that low. If you think a little padding would be good, let me know.

I guess this wasn't an OS specific bug after all! ;)
